definition: to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
(theater etc) to tour/to be on tour/to give itinerant performances

sentences.english: The crowd greeted the performers with boos and hiss es.
sentences.chinese: 观众向演出者发出一片嘘声。

sentences.english: He got a whole sackful of letters from listeners following the show.
sentences.chinese: 演出后他收到大量的听众来信。

sentences.english: Sinatra always made it all about him, and this is maybe his best-ever performance.
sentences.chinese: 辛纳屈一贯地全力以赴，而这次是他史上最棒的演出。

sentences.english: Basso continuo will be played here by the guitar.
sentences.chinese: 在本场演出里，则将由吉他来演奏通奏低音。
克鲁塞的演出才是关键。

sentences.english: The performance was rounded off with group-singing.
sentences.chinese: 演出在合唱声中圆满结束。

sentences.english: Think small, dream big. A simple space sparking off infinite possibilities.
sentences.chinese: “小剧场”的演出发生在一个简朴的空间。

sentences.english: The Dramatic Society are doing 'Hamlet next year.
sentences.chinese: 戏剧社准备明年演出《哈姆雷特》。

sentences.english: Nancy:This theatre company is very avantgarde.
sentences.chinese: 这个戏剧团的演出非常前卫。

sentences.english: So, we may enjoy wonderful performances from all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 那我们就能欣赏到来自世界各地的精彩演出了。

sentences.english: He was to play the professor, reprising the role he'd done years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他饰演教授一角，重新演出两年前演过的角色。

sentences.english: Theatres put on special shows for children during the Christmas season.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节期间剧院为儿童举行专场演出。

sentences.english: We watched a performance which included a puppet show and acrobatics .
sentences.chinese: 我们观看了一场演出，内容有木偶戏和杂技。

sentences.english: Her next performance is scheduled for Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 她下一场演出已经定在巴西。

sentences.english: Each screened performance is a unique combination of audiovisuals.
sentences.chinese: 每一段投射的演出都有著结合声音影像的独特。

sentences.english: Jonathan trained at Guildford School of Acting.
sentences.chinese: 卢克毕业于吉尔福德演出研究学院。

definition: to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture
maiden stage role/first performance/first public showing
(theater etc) to tour/to be on tour/to give itinerant performances
(theater etc) to tour/to be on tour/to give itinerant performances/abbr. for 巡迴演出|巡回演出[xun2 hui2 yan3 chu1]
